summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, dated October 25, 2020, regarding the confirmation of FBI inventory numbers for electronic devices seized in the Epstein/Maxwell cases. The email includes a spreadsheet and references a search warrant from June 2020, with the intent to provide a version of the inventory to Maxwell's attorneys.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, who is compiling and requesting confirmation of FBI inventory numbers for electronic devices seized in the Epstein/Maxwell cases, with the intent to share information with the defense.

events.title: Execution of Search Warrant for Electronic Devices
events.description: A search warrant was executed resulting in the seizure of 62 electronic devices related to the Epstein/Maxwell cases.

events.title: Email Confirming Device Inventory
events.description: An AUSA emails colleagues to confirm the accuracy of a compiled spreadsheet of FBI inventory numbers for electronic devices seized in the Epstein/Maxwell cases, referencing a June 2020 warrant and a draft warrant from the previous Friday.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A spreadsheet was compiled listing all electronic devices seized under warrants in the Epstein/Maxwell cases, including FBI 1.8 numbers, barcode numbers, and CART numbers.
A June 2020 search warrant covered 62 of these devices, and a draft warrant from October 23, 2020, covered three additional devices.
The prosecution planned to provide a version of the confirmed device inventory chart to Maxwell's defense attorneys.
